channel.title: Is it possible to
channel.description:
Well I was wondering
On a Counter Strike 1.6 StandAlone
Is it possible to make a website for it?
Basically like an online control panel.
Pics: [IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w160/albanian4life_2007/iui.jpg[/img] & [IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w160/albanian4life_2007/untitled-1.jpg[/img] & [IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w160/albanian4life_2007/111.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Any idea how to do this on freewebs or any other free websites.
WetPaint etc.
So the person can control it online
And if you can post and links and tutorials!
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Is it possible to
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“lordbost, post:6, topic:182106”]I am not sure, but I think you can use freehostia[/quote]I don’t think 250mb will handle a stand alone. Thanks though.

[quote=“vbcoderx, post:7, topic:182106”]erm… i imagine you could use another site, but i imagine it wouldn’t be worth the trouble… you should run an http server on the same comp your running the CS server on… and then read up about making it do shit/ control the options…[/quote]I have no idea what an HTTP server is, I can’t find anything on google. CAn you link me or explain please. Thanks! Oh and I was going to host it off my computer. 24/7

Read full topic

@vbcoderx wrote:

erm… i imagine you could use another site, but i imagine it wouldn’t be worth the trouble… you should run an http server on the same comp your running the CS server on… and then read up about making it do shit/ control the options…

item.title: Is it possible to
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

You would need to make your own HTTP server control panel wrapper.
Look around on the internet on how to interop with applications, the read up about the HTTP protocol, make a app that runs as an HTTP server and CS1.6 server interopper, and voila!

[size=14pt]tl;dr:
Yah, possible[/size]

tl;dr = too long, didn’t read

Read full topic
